assoc_actor_1: Students (Philippines)
notes: A college fraternity of the University of Philippines used its annual naked run to protest the declaration of Martial Law and the government's war on drugs in Quezon City, Metro Manila, National Capital Region on 1 Dec.

Troops from the 73rd Battalion under the 102nd Infantry Brigade encountered 15 members of the New People's Army at Barangay Pag-Asa in Alabel, Sarangani, Soccskargen on Dec 1. The military recovered a number of weapons from the encounter site. 2 members of the NPA were killed.
A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Bacolod, Negros Occidental on 01 Dec 2017.

source: ABS CBN; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at San Pablo, Laguna on 01 Dec 2017.

An unidentified group of armed men fired at a police officer and civilians along a road in Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija, Central Luzon Dec 1. The policeman and 3 of the civilians were in a pick-up truck, while 2 of the civilians were bystanders. Six people were wounded.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A former employee of a suspected drug lord was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at Albuera town, Leyte province on 1 December.

On 1 Dec 2017, a councilman and his wife were killed and their house set on fire by alleged Maute group over a land dispute in Brgy. Matampay, Marantao, Lanao del Sur. The children of the deceased were able to identify the perpetrators as their relatives and members of Maute.
The New People's Army killed a police officer in a roadside ambush in Barangay Daguit in Labo, Camarines, Bicol Region on Dec 2. Seven others were wounded.

20 members of New People's Army killed town councilor Angelo Luis at Barangay Awallan in Baggao, Cagayan, Cagayan Valley on December 2 because he was supposedly an 'undercover agent' for the military.

Around 60 members of the New People's Army attacked the police at their station in Binuangan town area, Misamis Oriental, Northern Mindanao on Dec 3. The NPA used both guns and a rocket launcher during the attack. 4 cops were wounded.

assoc_actor_2: Lumad Ethnic Group (Philippines); Manobo Ethnic Group (Philippines); Government of the Philippines (2016-)
source: ABS CBN; The Guardian; States News Service (Philippines)
notes: On 3 Dec 2017, in Barangay Ned, Lake Sebu, South Cotabato, 8 T'boli-Manobo S'daf Claimants Organization (TAMASCO) members, including the village chief, died after the 27th Infantry Battalion opened fire in their village. The military claims the victims were NPA members killed in an encounter with the military. Rights groups, however, claim that the victims are civilians and have been fighting against businesses and development projects which are using their ancestral lands.

assoc_actor_1: Pinagkaisang Samahan ng mga Tsuper at Operator Nationwide (Piston)
source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine News Agency
notes: On 4 Dec 2017, around 28 vehicles joined a caravan protest led by the Pinag-Isang Samahan ng mga Tsuper at Operator Nationwide (Piston) in Iloilo City to denounce the planned phase-out of jeepneys 15 years and older, Tax Reform for Acceleration and Inclusion (TRAIN) and the hike in oil prices.

On 4 Dec 2017, anti-mining activists from towns of Zambales, Manicani, and Homonhon, Eastern Samar held a protest outside the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) in Quezon City to denounce open-pit mining

On 4 Dec 2017, 8:30AM, in Salcedo area, Ilocos Sur, a 30-minute firefight occurred between 15 New People's Army (NPA) Platun Sis (Sandino) members and the 71st Division Reconnaissance Company/81st Infantry Battalion. An undetermined number of casualties from the NPA were reported.

Agreement: On 4 Dec 2017, the Bayabao and Enterino clans who belong to the same family from the coastal towns of Malabang and Balabagan settled their rido which started during the May 16 elections by signing peace agreement and swearing in the Qur'an.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu
notes: On 4 Dec 2017, a retired priest and coordinator of the Rural Missionaries of the Philippines was shot dead by motorcycle-riding gunmen while he was driving along Brgy. Lambakin, Jaen, Nueva Ecija. The victim facilitated the release of a political prisoner who was detained at the BJMP jail in Cabanatuan city before he was killed.
On 5 Dec 2017, the Abu Sayyaf Group harassed a community in Brgy. Langpas, Indanan, Sulu, killing at least 3 civilians and wounding others. One of the members was arrested on 6 Dec 2017.

Weapons Seizure: On 5 Dec 2017, the 62nd Infrantry Battalion discovered a New People's Army (NPA) encampment in Brgy. Buenavista, Himamaylan City area, Negros Occidental. The army seized the camp's tools, equipment, paraphernalia, and medicines among others.

On 5 Dec 2017, 3 civilians were allegedly abducted by the Maute and later killed around 6 Dec 2017. Local reports said civilians were abducted near their workplace, which is possibly in Marawi area or in other areas of Lanao del Sur province.

The bodies of three victims who were allegedly abducted by Maute in the early week of Dec 2017, were recovered in the borders of Piagapo area and Dado Balindong, Lanao del Sur on 7 Dec 2017. Locals reported seeing unidentified men wearing black clothing and carrying alleged ISIS flags arrive in the area the night of 6 Dec 2017 and hearing gunshots thereafter.

Agreement: Following the firefight incident on 29 Nov 2017 which signalled the severance of their 'bodong,' a bilateral peace system practiced by Kalinga native tribes, the Gaang and Dacalan Tribes in Kalinga exchanged sipat or peace tokens on 6 Dec 2017 which symbolizes the first stage in the restoration of the bodong.

assoc_actor_1: KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights
notes: On 6 Dec 2017, a protest led by Barug Katungod Mindanao and Karapatan occurred in front of Camp Aguinaldo, Quezon City, Metro Manila, opposing extra judicial killings in Mindanao.

Agreement: Following the shooting incident on 29 Aug 2017 which signalled the severance of their 'bodong,' a bilateral peace system practiced by Kalinga native tribes, the Tulgao and Tinglayan Tribes in Kalinga exchanged sipat or peace tokens on 7 Dec 2017 which symbolizes the first stage in the restoration of the bodong.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: Drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Sitio Lote, Brgy. Kayaga, Kabacan, North Cotabato on 7 Dec 2017.
On 7 Dec 2017, a former New People's Army (NPA) member, was shot by two unidentified assailants in Sitio Cabangaan, Brgy. Samariniana, Brooke's Point, Palawan.

On 7 Dec 2017, in Sitio Cunalom, Brgy. Carabalan, Himamaylan City area, Negros Occidental, a battle between the 62nd Infantry Battalion and about 30 alleged New People's Army (NPA) occurred leaving 2 soldiers wounded.

On 7 Dec 2017, more than 50 members of Barug Katungod Mindanao (Mindanao Stand for Human Rights) staged a protest in Padre Faura Street, Ermita, Manila, Metro Manila opposing the Supreme Court's decision of upholding the constitutionality of Martial Law in Mindanao.

On 7 Dec 2017, a Technical Education and Skills Development Authority (TESDA) Negros Occidental Director was shot and wounded by unidentified armed men in Trangka Street, Brgy. Zone 12, Talisay City, Negros Occidental.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine News Agency
notes: On Dec 8, in Sitio Buling-Buling, Brgy. Su-uh, Panamao, Sulu, a 10-min battle ensued between soldiers and 20 members of the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) led by Radullan Sahiron, killing 3 ASG members.

On 8 Dec 2017, Sulong Kultura (Sukol) member was killed and his brother went missing. Karapatan claimed the victim died in Brgy. Callawa while police report said he died in Brgy. Pangyan. Police reports also claimed that he is part of the Special Partisan Unit (Sparu) of the New People's Army (NPA) group and was about to surrender to authorities when the incident happened.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: Three drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Polomolok, South Cotabato on 08 Dec 2017.

On 13 Dec 2017, a 3-hour firefight occurred between the Army's 53rd Infantry Battalion and New People's Army's (NPA's) Western Mindanao Regional Party Committee in Gasa, Lakewood, Zamboanga del Sur, leaving 1 NPA killed and 3 soldiers wounded. NPA grenade launchers, ammunition and tactical radios were recovered by the military in the encounter site.

assoc_actor_1: Lumad Ethnic Group (Philippines); Moro Muslim Group (Philippines); KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights; Kalipunan ng Damayang Mahihirap (Kadamay)
notes: On 8 Dec 2017, protesters gather in Mendiola Street, San Miguel, Manila, Metro Manila to partake in the celebration of the Human Rights Day, opposing the martial law in Mindanao, attacks in lumad communities, and the administration's war on drugs.
On 8 Dec 2017, in a case of extra-judicial killings Aldrin Sese of Pamalakaya was shot and killed by unidentified armed men, suspected state agents, in Lagundi village, Batuan, Masbate

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified gunman at Quezon City, Metro Manila on 08 Dec 2017.

notes: On 8 Dec 2017, in Purok 7, Brgy. Banase, Baleno, Masbate, a firefight occurred between the New People's Army (NPA) and the 2nd Infantry Battalion (2IB), 9th Infantry Division of the Philippine Army (PA) and the Police Regional Office (PRO5) and Regional Intelligence Unit (RIU). A number of NPAs were injured and their weapons seized.

On 9 Dec 2017, the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) detonated an improvised bomb along a road in Brgy. Mirab, Upi, Maguindanao injuring six (6) 5th Marine Battalion Landing Team members. The BIFF claimed responsibility for the attack but investigators are not convinced of this claim.
On 9 Dec 2017, five fishermen were attacked by two armed coastal patrols, Bantay Dagat, in the waters off Libay area, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte, leaving a fisherman wounded and missing.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Manila Times; Philippine Star
notes: On 9 Dec 2017, armed men fired a grenade from an M203 launched which landed on a roadside police outpost of the 1st Maneuver Platoon of the Provincial Public Safety Company in Brgy. Nuro, Upi, Maguindanao and severely injured a police officer. The BIFF claimed responsibility for the attack but investigators are not convinced of this claim.
On International Human Rights Day, 10 Dec 2017, around 1,000 people attended a protest as they march from the provincial capitol to Crossing-Banga in Kalibo, Aklan.

assoc_actor_1: Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan); KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights
notes: On International Human Rights Day, 10 Dec 2017, around 2,500 individuals attended a protest led by Movement Against Tyranny and Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan) in Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental to demand justice for slain Mantapi Ebwan Farmers Association (MEFA) member Elioterio Moises and to protest human rights violations under the administration of President Rodrigo Duterte.

On International Human Rights Day, 10 Dec 2017, slain activist Elisa 'Nene' Badayos was buried and a funeral march was held in Cebu City, Cebu to demand justice and to protest human rights violations against human rights activists and workers under the administration of President Rodrigo Duterte.

assoc_actor_1: Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan)
notes: On International Human Rights Day, 10 Dec 2017, around 1,000 individuals attended a protest led by Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan) in Roxas City Plaza Bandstand in Roxas City, Capiz.

assoc_actor_1: Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan)
notes: On International Human Rights Day, 10 Dec 2017, hundreds attended a protest led by Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan) in Magsaysay Park, Cagayan de Oro City, Misamis Oriental, to protest human rights violations and the rising dictatorship under the administration of President Rodrigo Duterte.

On International Human Rights Day, 10 Dec 2017, around 8,000 protesters gather from Bonifacio Shrine to Mendiola, Manila, Metro Manila to express their concern about the rising human rights violations, poverty, militarization, impunity and dictatorship in the Philippines under the administration of President Rodrigo Duterte

assoc_actor_1: KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights

On 11 Dec 2017, 3,000 locals attended a mass rally against extremism which started at the Cotabato City State Polytechnic College and towards the Cotabato City plaza in Cotabato City, Cotabato.

On 12 Dec 2017, in Brgy. Salvacion, Magallanes, Sorsogon, a battle occurred between 30 New People's Army (NPA) led by Edwin Dematera alyas 'Dupax' and the Army's 31st Infantry Battalion. One NPA was killed.
On 12 Dec 2017, in Brgy. Calomagon, Bulan, Sorsogon, a battle occurred between 2 New People's Army (NPA) members and the Army's 31st Infantry Battalion. No casualties reported.

A drug and bombing suspect was killed at a police checkpoint in Brgy. Dansuli, Isulan, Sultan Kudarat on 12 Dec 2017, before 7am. The police said he tried to throw a hand grenade which prompted the policemen to shoot at him. The checkpoint is intended for a report received by the police that a bomb would be transported from Maguindanao.

notes: Agreement: On 12 Dec 2017, 200 men and 90 women from the Underground Mass Organizations (UGMOs) of the Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army (CPP-NPA) surrendered themselves and their weapons to the 701st Infantry Battalion through its community support program in Pantukan area, Davao de Oro .

Defusal: On 12 Dec 2017, a PRB-423 grenade was found and deactivated by police bomb experts inside the Department of Public Works and Highways-Cotabato District Office in Ramon Rabago Sr. St., Motorpool Access Road, Cotabato City, Cotabato.

assoc_actor_1: JI: Jemaah Islamiyah
notes: Defusal: On 12 Dec 2017, 5:50PM, an IED was found by the roadside along Shariff Aguak area, Maguindanao. It was later on disarmed by military bomb disposal unit. The Army's 6th Infantry Division civil military operations office reported that the grenade bore the signature style of Jemaah Islamiyah and Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters.

On the morning of 13 Dec 2017, two local barangay officials were shot while 2 others were wounded after 5 unidentified armed men ambushed them in Brgy. Annanuman, San Pablo, Isabela. The motivation for the incident might be personal but is still for verification.

On 13 Dec 2017, a soldier was shot by unidentified armed group during a drinking session with 2 other soldiers at Brgy. Sanito, Ipil area, Zamboanga Sibugay. One civilian and the two other soldiers were injured and were taken to the hospital.

A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Brgy. Turo, Bocaue, Bulacan on 13 Dec 2017.

A drug suspect was shot and wounded in a vigilante-style attack by 4 unidentified armed men at Barangay Ugac Norte, Tuguegarao, Cagayan on 11 Dec 2017. His companion, who had no criminal record, was shot and killed due to the incident.

source: ABS CBN; Foundation for Media Alternatives

On 17 Dec 2017, in Luno-Luno, Brgy. Gupitan, Kapalong, Davao del Norte, a village chieftain was shot by suspected New People's Army (NPA) rebels led by Tata Catarata, for allegedly refusing to give in to their extortion demands

Member of the militant Compostela Farmers Association (CFA), was reported missing 15 Dec 2017 after she left her home 14 Dec 2017. Her body was found later on 17 Dec 2017 at a funeral home in Nabunturan area, Davao de Oro
18 Dec 2017, a firefight occurred between Army's 74th Infantry Battalion and the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) in Brgy. Badja, Tipo-Tipo, Basilan, leaving one soldier dead and 2 others wounded.

notes: A drug suspect was killed during a shootout with the police at Brgy. Caniogan, Pasig City, Metro Manila on 18 Dec 2017, 12:00PM. One policeman was also killed and another one was wounded during the shootout.

An Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded in Brgy. Kulaybato, Lamitan City, Basilan. No one was hurt in the incident. Authorities believed that the ASG used the IED as bait for the ambush and firefight that followed between the military and the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) in Brgy. Badja, Tipo-Tipo, Basilan.

Around 25 Dec 2017, the military launched series of airstrikes targeting the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in Datu Hoffer area, Maguindanao.

Assumed on 25-26 Dec 2017, airstrikes and ground operations were conducted by the military against the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in Brgy. Maitemaig, Datu Unsay, Maguindanao.
